intro: Calamina mutica, commonly known as the slender calamina, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
